intro: Radlkoferella valenzuelana, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its fruits are fleshy berries that contain numerous seeds. Radlkoferella valenzuelana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its nocturnal blooms.
